Sir marginal revenue can be negative as written in books and tell me how??? but that means the shopkeeper is giving the commodity along with money is it possible !!!
No it is not! So MR can not be negative
Sal you're a blessing to this universe.
I was kinda looking forward to see you find the derivative of TR to find MR. LOL

hello, thanks for this video it is very informative!

I've just one question, if we calculate the marginal return by using the Mr curve= -2q+6 versus finding marginal return by writing out a table of total revenue, and calculating each change in total revenue at different quantities, I'll have different answer. why is that so??

ie

MR at Q=3, by MR equation:
MR =-2Q + 6 =-2(3)+6 = 0

but by calculating total revenue change:
total revenue at Q=2
TR(2) = -2Qsq + 6Q = -(2)sq + 6(2) = 8
total revenue at Q = 3
TR(3)= -2Qsq + 6Q = -(3)sq +6(3) = 9
hence MR at Q=3 is:
TR(3) - TR(2) = 1??
thumbs up when the calc scared the shit out of you
